title: Learning continuous SOC-dependent thermal decomposition kinetics for Li-ion cathodes using KA-CRNNs
summary: Thermal runaway in lithium-ion batteries is strongly influenced by the state of charge (SOC). Existing predictive models typically infer scalar kinetic parameters at a full SOC or a few discrete SOC levels, preventing them from capturing the continuous SOC dependence that governs exothermic behavior during abuse conditions.
